caption: First time eating Ethiopian food the lentils were delicious the spices were perfect all the food was cooked to perfection. The lamb was delicious. I enjoyed drinking the Ethiopian beers. The ambiance of the place was charming and the server was very helpful and everything could not have been better.
Absolutely loved the Hanoi Signature! Sweet and tangy broth with perfectly seasoned pork.

I ordered the round trip combo consisting of waffle wrap egg rolls and shredded chicken sticky rice and signature boba tea. The flavor was delicious and everything tasted fresh. The combo is a great deal and the food was delicious!

Cute place ! Friendly service! Wish I had tried sooner! Had their combo and I enjoyed EVERY part of it. The best banh mi I've ever had... the bread was toasted just right and meat was tender. Can't wait to try more from the menu. The name of the restaurant isn't the easiest to lookup or remember. Doesn't come up in a search for vietmanese food near me.
Pretty good vietnamese food!
Cute decor, great food! We tried a number of different dishes and each was consistently fantastic!!
Excellent service. Good Pho!

The Hanoi fried beef noodles, Vietnamese egg rolls, and milk tea were amazing! Also, the takeout order was neatly/well packed, which I really appreciated. Among the best noodles I have ever had on U St, and only available milk tea within walking distance of my home.
A great spot with great customer service and seasonal cocktails. The food is better than you'd expect on "U street". Highly recommend.

If I could give 1914 more than five stars, I would. Vietnamese food is excellent in general, and this is the best Vietnamese food I've had outside of Vietnam. The bun cha has a beautiful flavor and freshness. Thw owners are wonderful and friendly, and the environment is relaxing. I could honestly be happy eating here every day, or close to it.
Excellent Vietnamese food.  Cool lay out and well decorated restaurant.  Very kid friendly!

Staff were extremely nice, and the food was delicious! There are three floors, but for now, only the middle and lower floor are in use for their soft opening. You can order drinks from the lower level, but all the menus (food & drink) are located at the mid-level area, so go there to order your food. They also have food displays in addition to their menus up there by the register, so you can see what the food will look like!  The middle level dining area is well lit, with two large tables and two smaller tables. The lower dining area has more of a bar vibe. Dimly lit, with a projector playing Vietnamese music videos on the wall.  We ordered the com tam and bun cha, as well as the egg milk coffee and egg milk cacao. Both the food and beverages were fantastic! Serving sizes were great as well. I would highly recommend this place, and I’ll be there for their grand opening for sure.

Me and bf came for the soft opening, and this place is amazing! Service is kind and attentive, wait time for food is reasonable and it tastes great ! (Solid 9/10 for all of our dishes) . There’s an upstairs and downstairs (down is the darker one), and the food menu/ordering is upstairs. Food pictured is the broken rice with chicken. If I lived closer I would regular this place. Everyone needs to stop by! (Also it isn’t a cold place so keep in mind if you sweat easy like me)

Food was delicious, staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. I am thrilled to have found this little corner of Hanoi in DC, interior decoration is such a mood! There’s three different floors all with different themes but congruous with the Vietnamese street concept. Drinks were strong and well made, you can tell the staff really cares. Looking forward to coming back and exploring more of the menu, also third floor bar. Thanks Ian!

Such a cute restaurant with a downstairs lounge for drinks and coffee. Upstairs makes you feel like you're in Vietnam with pieces of art or decoration that are unique to Vietnam. The aesthetics aren't even the best part!  The food is authentic vietnamese (according to my vietnamese girlfriend) and is very affordable. Staff are friendly and attentive. I will be going back.  Must haves are the sticky rice with pork and Bun Cha Ha Noi.
This place is lit!! It’s a picture perfect area the food is really good too!! Will come back to try more 😁
Best Bun Cha ever!!!

Awesome place! Super friendly and attentive staff, killer decor (indoor bus and motorcycle). Sticky rice with BBQ pork is incredible. Corn milk is nectar from the nipple of Aphrodite. Will be coming back for sure.

Went to pick up lunch during the soft opening. While the didn't have banh mi yet, they have a good selection of Vietnamese dishes. We ordered iced coffee and bun cha, shrimp rolls, and chicken fried rice. Everything was tasty and hit the spot. The inside is well designed too with each floor having a theme. Can't wait to check out more offerings!

Tried the wings and shrimp roll - both perfect snack bites. Wings had a special Thai-style sauce that I really enjoyed also! Owners are also super friendly and accommodating - definitely can't wait to go back! There is also a classy bar/lounge being built upstairs that make it a great place to grab a quick dinner and hang for the evening.
The Capital of Vietnam is now at the Capital of USA with great food and good vibe.
Simply awesome , amazing staff, good food, highly recommended for any occasion! In love with the vibe of that place
